item.title: Getting started with https
item.description: Getting started with HTTPS # HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is an encrypted version of HTTP protocol, most often used in connection with services where only the sender and receiver must know the message. It’s required if you handle credit card information, and will improve your rank on Google. To enable HTTPS you need to check if your web host supports itâ€”if you don’t know you can ask their support for help and information about it.

item.title: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)
item.description: Parameters # Parameter Details max-age=31536000 Time in seconds. HSTS will be enforced for this future time period. includeSubDomains HSTS should be applied for this domain and all of its sub-domains. preload This domain agrees to be included in a HSTS pre-load list See also MDN - HTTP Strict Transport Security Wikipedia - HTTP Strict Transport Security HSTS preload list HSTS Header # Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains Strict-Transport-Security is a promise to the browser that all future requests to this domain will be secure.
